summary.p: This type is only available in .NET. Its C++ equivalent is float3.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of Vector3.
member.param: Initial value for the x component of the vector.
Initial value for the y component of the vector.
Initial value for the z component of the vector.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.#ctor(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of Vector3.
member.param: A vector containing the values to initialize x and y components with.
Initial value for the z component of the vector.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.#ctor(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of Vector3.
member.param: Value to initialize each component to.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.Length
member.summary: Calculates the length, or Euclidean distance, of the vector.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.LengthSquared
member.summary: Calculates the length, or Euclidean distance, of the vector squared.

member.summary: Calculates the Euclidean distance between two vectors.

member.summary: Calculates the Euclidean distance between two vectors squared.

member.summary: Calculates the cross product of two vectors.

member.summary: Calculates the dot product of two vectors.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.Normalize(System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a unit vector from the specified vector.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.Min(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns a vector that contains the lowest value from each matching pair of components.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.Max(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns a vector that contains the highest value from each matching pair of components.

member.summary: Restricts a value to be within a specified range.

member.summary: Performs a linear interpolation between two vectors.

member.summary: Determines the reflect vector of the given vector and normal.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.Transform(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Matrix4x4)
member.summary: Transforms the vector (x, y, z, 1) by the specified matrix.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.TransformNormal(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Matrix4x4)
member.summary: Transforms the normal vector (x, y, z, 0) by the specified matrix.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.Transform(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Quaternion)
member.summary: Transforms a Vector3 by the given quaternion.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.op_Equality(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary: Determines whether two instances of Vector3 are equal.
member.remarks: Uses an exact floating point equality comparison, which is not advised if the values being compared are the result of computations which could have introduced floating point precision errors. In such cases, comparing DistanceSquared against a very small tolerance threshold may be a better approach.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.op_Inequality(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary: Determines whether two instances of Vector3 are not equal.
member.remarks: Uses an exact floating point equality comparison, which is not advised if the values being compared are the result of computations which could have introduced floating point precision errors. In such cases, comparing DistanceSquared against a very small tolerance threshold may be a better approach.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.Equals(System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified Vector3 is equal to the Vector3.
member.remarks: Uses an exact floating point equality comparison, which is not advised if the values being compared are the result of computations which could have introduced floating point precision errors. In such cases, comparing DistanceSquared against a very small tolerance threshold may be a better approach.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified Object is equal to the Vector3.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.ToString
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the current Vector3.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets the hash code for this object.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.op_Implicit(System.Numerics.Vector3)~Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector3
member.summary: Converts a System.Numerics.Vector3 to a Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector3.
member.remarks: This allows application code to use the rich System.Numerics math types, then pass these objects directly to WinRT APIs that use the WinRT structs from Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector3.op_Implicit(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector3)~System.Numerics.Vector3
member.summary: Converts a Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector3 to a System.Numerics.Vector3.
member.remarks: This allows application code to use the rich System.Numerics math types, and assign to these objects directly from the return values of WinRT APIs that use the WinRT structs from Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.

member.summary: X component of the vector.

member.summary: Y component of the vector.

member.name: F:System.Numerics.Vector3.Z
member.summary: Z component of the vector.

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector3.Zero
member.summary: Returns a Vector3 with all of its components set to zero.

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector3.One
member.summary: Returns a Vector3 with all of its components set to one.

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector3.UnitX
member.summary: Returns the Vector3 (1, 0, 0).

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector3.UnitY
member.summary: Returns the Vector3 (0, 1, 0).

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector3.UnitZ
member.summary: Returns the Vector3 (0, 0, 1).
